intro: Lichtensteinia inebrians, commonly known as the red sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its erect, branching stems and clusters of small, bright red or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance. Lichtensteinia inebrians is a member of the Acanthaceae family, known for its showy inflorescences and medicinal properties in some traditional uses.
